defs.docs:
# Rust Chess Library
 This is a chess move generation library for rust.  It is designed to be fast, so that it can be
 used in a chess engine or UI without performance issues.

attributes.value: / This is a chess move generation library for rust.  It is designed to be fast, so that it can be
/ used in a chess engine or UI without performance issues.
/ This generates all the moves on the starting chess position, and checks that the number of

defs.name: is_sane

 This is for sanity checking.

defs.name: BitBoard

 using the implemented operators to work with this object.

defs.name: new
defs.docs:
Create a new `CacheTable` with each associated entry initialized with a hash of '0'
 Note: You must pass in a size where only 1 bit is set. (AKA: 2, 4, 8, 16, 1024, 65536,
 etc.)
 Panics when size is invalid.

defs.name: replace_if
defs.value: pub fn replace_if<F: Fn(T) -> bool>(&mut Self, u64, T, F)
defs.docs:
Replace an entry in the hash table with a user-specified replacement policy specified by
 `replace`. The `replace` closure is called with the previous entry occupying the hash table
 slot, and returns true or false to specify whether the entry should be replaced. Note that
 the previous entry may not have the same hash, but merely be the default initialization or
 a hash collision with `hash`.

attributes.value: / Replace an entry in the hash table with a user-specified replacement policy specified by

/ slot, and returns true or false to specify whether the entry should be replaced. Note that
/ the previous entry may not have the same hash, but merely be the default initialization or
/ // Note that 'a' is the default initialization value.

defs.name: MoveGen
defs.docs: An incremental move generator

attributes.value: / This structure enumerates moves slightly slower than board.enumerate_moves(...),
/ but has some extra features, such as:
/ * Not requiring you to create a buffer
/ * Only iterating moves that match a certain pattern
/ * Being iterable multiple times (such as, iterating once for all captures, then iterating again
/ * Doing as little work early on as possible, so that if you are not going to look at every move, the
/ * Being able to iterate pseudo legal moves, while keeping the (nearly) free legality checks in
/ // create a board with the initial position
/ assert_eq!(iterable.len(), 20); // the .len() function does *not* consume the iterator
/     // This move captures one of my opponents pieces (with the exception of en passant)
/ // now, iterate over the rest of the moves
/     // This move does not capture anything

For now, Only iterate moves that land on the following squares
 Note: Once iteration is completed, you can pass in a mask of ! `EMPTY`
       to get the remaining moves, or another mask

defs.name: legal_quick
defs.docs: This function checks the legality *only for moves generated by `MoveGen`*.

attributes.value: / This function checks the legality *only for moves generated by `MoveGen`*.
/ Calling this function for moves not generated by `MoveGen` will result in possibly
/ incorrect results, and making that move on the `Board` will result in undefined behavior.
/ This function may panic! if these rules are not followed.
/ If you are validating a move from a user, you should call the .legal() function.

    MakeMove(ChessMove),

    DeclareDraw,
    Resign(Color),
}

}

defs.name: BoardBuilder
defs.docs: Represents a chess position that has *not* been validated for legality.

attributes.value: / Represents a chess position that has *not* been validated for legality.
/ This structure is useful in the following cases:
/ * You are trying to build a chess board manually in code.
/ * The `Board` structure will try to keep the position fully legal, which will prevent you from
/   placing pieces arbitrarily.  This structure will not.
/ * You want to display the chess position in a UI.
/ * You want to convert between formats like FEN.
/ use chess::{BoardBuilder, Board, Square, Color, Piece};
/ // You can index the position by the square:
/ // White is in check, but that's ok, it's white's turn to move.
/ // Now White is in check, but Black is ready to move.  This position is invalid.
/ // One liners are possible with the builder pattern.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Construct a new, empty, BoardBuilder.

attributes.value: / * No pieces are on the board
/ use chess::{BoardBuilder, Board, Square, Color, Piece};

                           Color, CastleRights, CastleRights, Option<File>)
-> BoardBuilder
